main event: Several witnesses reported a sighting of a bright star-like object in the sky which they initially described as moving slowly but stable.
interesting points: The sighting was observed over several nights, specifically noted from June 28 to July 11, 1958., The observer compared the object to a baseball and suggested it changed brightness, likely due to atmospheric conditions., Witnesses included a former weather observer from the US Navy., An official investigation was carried out with negative results concerning any civil or military air traffic at the time of the sightings., One investigator concluded that the object was likely the star 'Arcturus'.
sighted object: A bright light in the sky resembling a star
witness description: One witness described seeing a luminous sphere that could change direction almost instantly; another reported seeing a hovering object about 12-15 feet off the ground.
